name: Clin N Ovary
title: Clinical N
notes:
**Note 1:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in the field distant metastasis. 

**Note 2:** Regional nodes include bilateral and contralateral named nodes. 

**Note 3:**  Federation Internationale de Gynecologie at d-Obstetrique (FIGO) Stage IIIC is assigned based on tumor extension and/or regional lymph node involvement.  Code regional lymph nodes based on a physician's statement of FIGO Stage IIIC only if it is known that the stage value is assigned because of lymph node involvement. 

**Note 4:**  If the clinician says "adnexa palpated" but doesn't mention lymph nodes, assume lymph nodes are not involved, assign N0.

**Note 5:**  If either exploratory or definitive surgery is done with no mention of lymph nodes, assume regional nodes are not involved.

**Regional lymph nodes:**

    Aortic:
        Lateral (lumbar)
        Para-aortic
        Periaortic
    Iliac:
       Common iliac
       External iliac
       Internal iliac (hypogastric):
           Obturator     
                Inguinal
    Intra-abdominal
    Pelvic
    Subdiaphragmatic
  
    Retroperitoneal, NOS
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Clinical evaluation but unknown results or regional lymph node involvement not stated
Clinical evaluation done but results not documented in patient record

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

FIGO IIIC based on regional lymph node involvement

Stated as N1

Clinical N is not defined for the specific site/histology
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM

No clinical evaluation of regional lymph nodes
Cancer first detected on surgical resection
Unknown if any clinical assessment performed
